definitions.definition: surrounded by somebody/something; in the middle of somebody/something

examples.text: I found the letter amongst his papers.
It's OK, you're among friends now.

definitions.definition: being included or happening in groups of things or people

examples.text: A British woman was among the survivors.
He was among the last to leave.
This attitude is common among the under-25s.
‘What was wrong with the job?’ ‘Well, the pay wasn't good, **among other things**.’
Discuss it **among yourselves** *(= with each other)* first.

definitions.definition: used when you are dividing or choosing something, and three or more people or things are involved

examples.text: They divided the money up among their three children.

wordOrigin: Old English ongemang (from on ‘in’ + gemang ‘assemblage, mingling’).
